attributes.action: For all schools in England to teach students the God Save The Queen.
attributes.background: For the British government to make it mandatory for all schools in England to teach all their students God Save The Queen.

attributes.action: Require a Register for Telecommunications to Publish EMF Radiation
attributes.background: EMF radiation in unsafe levels is a threat to public health and safety.  A public register for telecommunications to publish EMF radiation from mast towers or similar is paramount for public health and authorities to monitor under national and international laws.
attributes.additional_details: A public register for telecommunication mast towers EMF radiation levels is needed.  Other industries are expected under Environmental Law, Public Health and Health and Safety to operate within national and international standards and even to publish for controls, management, obligation and accountability.  Telecommunication companies have many of their mast towers in residential areas and do not publish public the EMF radiation levels past or present and a threat to public health.

attributes.action: Compulsory labelling of recyclability on all products
attributes.background: Many products don't explicitly state whether or not they are recyclable. This creates a lot of confusion and results in recyclable items being put in normal waste bins, which is detrimental to the environment. If non-recyclable items are wrongly disposed of, they can disrupt the recycling process.

attributes.action: Expedite legislation guaranteeing the right to vote for UK citizens for life.
attributes.background: UK citizens residing outside the UK lose the right to vote in UK elections and referenda after 15 years as an overseas elector. The government had said it would introduce legislation to change this, giving the right to vote for life. That legislation should be introduced within the next 6 months.

attributes.action: Start dredging rivers regularly in the help of flood prevention.
attributes.background: Cumbria has suffered many bad floods over the last 13 years and it's time something was done. Flood defences only slow down the water but actually clearing the rivers of silt and debris would be more effective. Also allowing farmers to manage rivers flowing through their land.

attributes.action: Remove all Tolls to cross over/under the River Mersey, via Bridges or Tunnels.
attributes.background:
The Mersey Tunnels have been tolled for years
The Mersey Road Bridges are following suit
The NW region  is struggling economically. 
Bring all Mersey crossings back into the National Roads structure, like similar structures in Wales and Scotland. This will develop a real "Northern Powerhouse".

attributes.action: Put the university fee down to £6000. Not fair on students too much burden.
attributes.background: Once the students have achieved their target they start working. It's really hard for students to work, study, they pay for traveling, food and accommodation. Once they start work it's not fair on them to pay back loan with interest. If the fee goes down to £6000 it makes it little easier.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding Parental Responsibility
attributes.background: When family member such as grandparent, aunt, uncle etc is bringing up a family member such as grandchild, nephew, niece etc, unless it would harm the child to do so such family members to be automatically granted Parental Responsibility.
attributes.additional_details: Tens of thousands of grandparents bringing up grandchildren in the absence of one or both parents cannot get Parental Responsibility without a tedious, expensive and often contentious court process. This applies even in cirumstances where the mother is deceased, the father shown not to be the biological father by DNA testing and not playing any part in bringing up the child concerned. Unless it would harm child to do so, Grandparents to be automatically given Parental Responsibility.

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: Let councils borrow to build council housing. Lift the government cap.
attributes.background:
Private tenancies are insecure, expensive and many fail to meet basic standards. 
So called "affordable housing" at 80% of market rents is not genuinely affordable. A programme  of council house building will help address the housing crisis, and council housing pays for itself in the long run.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules severely restrict council's ability to borrow to build desperately needed council housing.
Council housing funding also needs to be raised to a sustainable level.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Stop car Insurance Companies from increasing drivers for no fault accident claim
attributes.background: Make applying financial increases to driver insurance premiums who have been involved in an accident with a non-insured driver or in a no fault accident, illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unreasonable and unjust that drivers whom are unfortunate in being involved in a no fault accidents, or those involved in incidents whereby the other driver is not insured; should suffer a financial increase on their own insurance premiums. 

We pay a huge amount of money to the Insurance sector to protect us against incidents where our vehicles are stolen or damaged. At the moment a no fault accident will attract a minimum of a 10.81% load on your premiums, how is this fair or just?

attributes.action: The Government make immediate preparations and employ more border personnel
attributes.background: That the Government must not delay any longer and must immediately hire more personnel, for customs and border security and be ready for brexit in March 2019. We were promised contol of our borders yet so far we have not seen evidence that any preparation has been made

attributes.action: Commission an urgent evaluation of the NHS 111 service.
attributes.background:
Research strongly suggests that:
1) Non-clinicians using computer software to manage calls to NHS111 may compromise patient safety.
2) Computer software used by NHS111 may lead to too many people being referred across to the 999 service with a consequent ambulance call out and attendance at A&E.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS England plan an ‘Integrated Urgent Care Clinical Assessment Service’ by March 2019. Without in-depth evaluation of NHS 111 the new service will offer little improvement to patients.

We want the Government to commission an independent body to evaluate NHS111 including analysis of calls and decision support software. Evidence and methods for such an evaluation are here:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0277953614008107 http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/3/11/e003451.short

attributes.action: Bring the Bayeux Tapestry to Hastings (or Battle).
attributes.background: It's great President Macron has agreed to loan the Bayeux Tapestry to the UK. It should be displayed in Hastings (or Battle), home of the historic battleground. It would also be a huge boost for the area's tourism.

attributes.action: Donald Trump should be refused entry to the UK
attributes.background: On account of his support for extremist organisations, and his lack of understanding of the consequences of his rhetoric, Donald Trump is not a fit and proper person to be permitted to enter the UK.

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Make prescriptions for epipens free to anaphylaxis sufferers on the NHS
attributes.background: Vital life-saving drugs qualify for free prescriptions on the NHS, such as those that treat diabetes. Anaphylaxis sufferers have to carry an epipen throughout their life. This is undoubtedly a life-saving medication and should qualify to be on the exemption certificate for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Re-nationalise the train service
attributes.background: Due to the privatisation of the train services, commuters have experienced frequent delays, with poorer service than would be expected of any EU country's services. On top of this, commuters face high fares, which are rising much faster than the rate of inflation.
attributes.additional_details: If we take Berlin and London, we can see a stark contrast in travel card prices there. For example, a day travel card in Berlin (zones ABC - which includes the city and its surrounding area) would cost an adult 7,70€ (£6.78), however, in London a day travel card (in zones 1-6) would cost an adult £11.70. The difference shows that a nationalised system is cheaper.

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my husband takes out our daughter and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! This means he either has to change her on the floor, bench or leave her until she gets home. This is not ideal.
attributes.additional_details:
There are so many more involved dads nowadays, diversification of families and opportunity of shared maternity leave. We need to make things more accessible for dads too!

Where changing facility are not in unisex toilets like disabled ones, i propose this be a legal requirement for these to be in both female and male toilets.

attributes.action: Allow adult British citizens the right to choose doctor-assisted suicide
attributes.background: Adults should have the right to choose authorised-doctor-assisted suicide in Britain, protected by legal safeguards established in consultation with interested parties, including mental health professionals and disability organisations.
attributes.additional_details: The legal rights to make end of life choices, such as putting a Do Not Attempt Resuscitation order in a Living Will, and to dignity already exist. Assisted suicide is legal in 5 European countries, Canada and several states in America. It is available to British citizens who are able to travel to the Swiss clinic Dignitas and are capable of receiving, and can afford to pay for, its services. It is not currently legal in Britain.

attributes.action: Stop shops opening on boxing day
attributes.background: Please give retail workers an extra day off to spend with their families

attributes.action: Offer Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe diplomatic protection and secure her release.
attributes.background: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been imprisoned unjustly in Iran and her case has been set back by Michael Gove and Boris Johnson’s failure to be clear about her motive for travel. She should be offered diplomatic protection and brought back to the UK, with her child Gabriella, as quickly as possible.

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.

attributes.action: Make not keeping receipts/basic accounts when you hold an LPA a criminal offence
attributes.background: Now, if you're entrusted with a vulnerable persons finances, a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) it is only suggested that you keep receipts/records/basic accounts to explain any purchases made. It should be a legal requirement to produce this if requested to help safeguard our vulnerable loved ones.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my father, Richard Nelson Scott, on 17/5/16. No one thinks that a family member will steal from their vulnerable, ill loved one but it happened to us. It's happening more now with our ageing population. Some get away with it by having an LPA. By amending current guidelines the LPA holder will have to produce records if a concerned person wants an investigation of financial affairs.

attributes.action: Adopt into UK law all anti-abuse measures of EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive.
attributes.background: Tax avoidance is widely accepted to be legal but both immoral and anti-social. As the EU’s anti tax avoidance directive can be universally accepted as a good thing and has not been a factor in public debate concerning the UK’s EU membership, the UK should opt in to the directive and implement fully.

attributes.action: Make environmental studies a mandatory subject in the National Curriculum
attributes.background: There is currently a lack of knowledge about the detrimental impacts that human activity has on the environment. If a mandatory environmental studies subject is placed in the national curriculum, then this may encourage future generations to act in a more environmentally-friendly manner.
attributes.additional_details: Topics could include – climate change, how much plastic is in the ocean, the impacts of litter on wildlife and the environment, how to live more sustainably/eco-friendly etc. Practicals could include litter picking, tree planting, and outdoor eco-volunteering sessions.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS from removing all funding ( £15 Million annually) FOR COMBAT STRESS
attributes.background: Combat Stress is the UK's best charity helping veterans in dire need of support and treatment from PTSD. The NHS  has decided to remove ALL FUNDING for the charity £15M annually. This is a disgrace and an outrage as Combat Stress has the most experienced professional staff to deal with PTSD!
attributes.additional_details: Combat Stress currently provide residential courses for 1 week as a preparation for treatment, the 6 week intensive therapy course has helped veterans from all conflicts deal with their symptoms, nightmares, night terrors, anxiety and soo much more. Don't abandon us now, help our veterans access this essential treatment. The NHS propose that all veterans should attend a day centre which is totally unrealistic, just ask the mental health professionals at Combat Stress. Please sign this petition!!

attributes.action: Reimburse the NHS from foreign aid budget 4 treatment given to foreign nationals
attributes.background:
Health tourism is costing the already strained NHS millions of pounds.
The NHS should be given a reimbursement from the foreign aid budget for any unrecovered costs of treatment of foreign nationals.

attributes.action: The Government should ensure women are fully represented across the curriculum.
attributes.background: In the centenary year since the passing of Representation of People Act which enabled women over 30 with property to vote, it seems fitting that the women’s struggle for equality and equity should be featured across the curriculum as should women’s achievements which are under represented

attributes.action: Split Leeds and Bradford City Councils into smaller district councils.
attributes.background: Leeds & Bradford City Councils are too large to focus of individual communities. On greenbelt protection, providing cheaper housing on brownfield sites, transport & modernising infrastructure, local people's views are often ignored. Smaller councils would be accountable to more localised voters.
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds & Bradford City Councils planned too much housing for greenbelt sites & failed to act sufficiently on local views. This would have defeated the objectives of greenbelt by merging communities with urban sprawl & destroying their historical character. Leeds' revised plans still have greenbelt in reserve for development as "Broad Locations".

An Act of Parliament could restore councils which existed before 1974, such as Aireborough, Horsforth, Keighley, Morley, Pudsey, Shipley & Wharfedale.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on motorways from 70mph to 80mph by 2022.
attributes.background: Speed limits on motorways need updating and speed cameras while there to provide a critically important deterrent stop drivers from going faster on a clear stretch of road. By increasing the speed limit on our motorways drivers would legally reduce travel time and make road travel more productive.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Nitrogen Dioxide exposure by expanding the UKs sensor network
attributes.background: Levels of Nitrogen Dioxide across the UK are constantly over WHO limits, causing detrimental damage to our health. Awareness of high pollution areas is still low as the monitoring set up covers very few locations so people cannot take informed decisions to reduce their exposure.
attributes.additional_details: Exposure to any amount of nitrogen dioxide impacts our health and  our children's health.  Despite this there is limited coverage of the exposure we face in our daily lives.  There are few monitors and no public information showing pollution across our transport network, in schools, offices and levels inside vehicles. We therefore call upon the government to increase awareness of NO2 exposure by funding additional sensors and research into hotspots so information is available to the public.

attributes.action: Make computer science controlled assessments (NEA'S) mandatory for the GCSE.
attributes.background: On Monday 27th November, news broke that Ofqual may be scrapping the coding element of some GCSE exams due to fairness of controlled assessments, and the breaking of rules. However this is ridiculous. How could you learn food technology without actually cooking, or physical education without sport.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal is to ensure that the examinations are going to stay reasonable, as in an ever increasing technological world, Britain's next generation could have a massive skills gap that increases. We would like to cement programming as a legal requirement for GCSE's to ensure positive outcomes.

attributes.action: Protect Hospitals with exclusion zones preventing protest outside
attributes.background:
Over the past few years a number of groups have set up protests and vigils outside of hospitals. 

We believe this is unacceptable, and that people should be able to access healthcare free from harassment.

The obvious exception being union organised protest for staff.
attributes.additional_details:
We respect the right to free speech, and the right to protest. However, these rights are not without exception, and they cannot be used in a manner which causes harm. 

Individuals also have the right to go about their lawful business free from harassment, and protests and vigils outside the hospital infringe upon this. 

Protests and vigils can be held in a number of places throughout the country, but hospitals are a place for healing. They are accessed by people in their most vulnerable state.

attributes.action: Reopen the Hambleton Village Railway Station
attributes.background: I'd like to propose the reopening of Hambleton Village Station (closed in 1959) due to massive population expansion with the nearest alternative stations being Selby and South Milford. These trains pass the old station platform anyway and could easily stop to collect!
attributes.additional_details: The original station was located at the end of Station Road, Hambleton YO8

attributes.action: Use foreign aid money to help in the Caribbean.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous not to use our foreign aid budget to help in the Caribbean, let common sense prevail and quickly.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/853897/Hurricane-Irma-UK-British-overseas-territory-foreign-aid-Boris-Johnson-Theresa-May

attributes.action: Ban the use of glitter and save our marine life!
attributes.background:
Tops Day Nurseries have made a pledge to become more sustainable and have recently discovered an unexpected item that has already had a detrimental effect on the environment… Glitter. 

Although much loved as an art and craft favourite, glitter is a microplastic, just like microbeads.
attributes.additional_details:
We already know that 100% of mussels found off France and Belgium have ingested microplastics and many fish have too; so if you eat shell fish you more than likely have eaten microplastics too, along with the toxic additives that manufacturers use which are known to copy oestrogen, and affect human fertility. 

As responsible people looking after the next generation, the last thing we want to do is damaging the environment or risking their health, so we need to act now and stop this pollution.

attributes.action: Give inshore fisherman (non-sector & under 10m boats) 30% share of the UK quota
attributes.background: The inshore fishing industry should be legally entitled to 30% of all UK quota. The current system is based on historical quota allocation which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details:
Under 10m boats make up 77% of the UK fleet but their quota pool only accounts for 1.5% of the national Fixed Quota Allocations (in tonnes). This directly causes wide spread discarding of marketable fish. 

Please see paper titled, How Government and Fisheries management policies caused over fishing in UK waters, on The British Fishing Industry Facebook page.

attributes.action: Increase Police Funding & the Number of Police Community Support Officers.
attributes.background: There has been a noticeable increase in crime across the UK particularly in knife, domestic burglary & vehicle-related crimes. It is apparent that the police force do not have the required resource to effectively tackle and resolve these increasing issues. We as UK citizens feel unsafe & uneasy.
attributes.additional_details: Between September 2016 and September 2017 the recorded crime rose across the UK by nearly 15%, with a rise of 21% in knife crime, a massive 32% rise in domestic burglary and an 18% increase in vehicle-related crimes. National police officer numbers have fallen to the lowest level in more than three decades. The statistics clearly show that the rise in crime in recent years is a national problem that requires national solutions.  It is a proven fact that police presence reduces crime.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Higher education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring the same protections for students who are mothers. This blind-spot has led to student mothers facing avoidable adversity in higher education.
attributes.additional_details:
In spite of the Equality Act 2010,  the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result.

Access to flexible working, maternity leave and breastfeeding facilities are examples of legal entitlements held by workers. There is no reason for student mothers not to be equally protected, when they are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination. This must change.

attributes.action: Cancel plans to make banks check the immigration status of account holders
attributes.background: Starting in January 2018, UK banks will be required to carry out quarterly immigration checks on all account holders. Those found to be resident without permission will have their accounts frozen or closed down. This ramping up of the 'hostile environment' strategy will have disastrous consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Under the immigration act 2014, status checks are required for anyone opening a new bank account in the UK. A 2016 report by the chief inspector of borders and immigration uncovered a 10% error rate. The Home Office simply does not have the administrative capacity or competence to execute checks on 70m accounts without causing huge collateral damage. More fundamentally, attempts to decrease net migration by denying irregular migrants access to necessities are draconian and inhumane.

attributes.action: Cut the "Aid budget" to other countries and use it to help our struggling NHS
attributes.background:
Our £13 Billion Aid budget needs to be cut for our struggling NHS. 
The NHS are struggling for staff, beds and resources to keep up with the growing demand. The NHS needs to be updated; with up to date systems/policies. 
Funding needs to be put into education, new staff and a important pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
References- 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/17/government-departments-struggling-spend-foreign-aid-budgets/amp/

attributes.action: Asthmatics should get free inhalers
attributes.background: Asthma is a condition that affects millions across the UK. Many asthmatics are admitted to hospital each year due to asthma. Asthmatics are forced to spend a large sum of money each month on medication.  If diabetics can get insulin for free then why can't asthmatics get free inhalers?

attributes.action: Support Kurdistan independence from Iraq
attributes.background: Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Unequivocally support the Kurdish people in Iraq.
2. Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
3. Provide every encouragement and assistance for the peaceful establishment of an independent, sovereign and free Kurdish state.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: Allow builders to remove fixed materials if work is unpaid
attributes.background: Many builders are working for the private sector and when final payment is due many clients don’t pay due to the law being on there side not allowing the removal of any unpaid fixed materials, we would like the law changed to allow us to remove any unpaid fixed materials to recover the costs

attributes.action: Make it law that university students get a refund for cancelled lectures
attributes.background: University staff are on strike for 4 weeks. Students have got into debt to cover the costs of their fees and it is only right that as consumers of a service they haven't received they should get a refund. Therefore all lectures scheduled but not delivered should be refunded.

attributes.action: Make part time schooling (flexischooling) a legal right for families.
attributes.background: Flexischooling is currently legal at the discretion of the head teacher, but many are too afraid of damaging their attendance statistics to agree. I call on the government to make flexischooling a legal right for all children.
